com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides static utility methods for use with String equations. Many local methods in other classes may be moved here if they need to have central use (especially methods in Validator.java)
    Author:
    Nateowami

    • Method Detail

      • areAllNumerals

        public static boolean areAllNumerals(java.lang.String n)
        Tells if a string contains only numerals. Examples: Util.allAreNumerals("234") returns true. Util.allAreNumerals("05") returns true. Util.allAreNumerals("-6") returns false. Returns false if n is an empty string.
        Parameters:
        n - The string to check
        Returns:
        True if n is not an empty string and contains only numerals, otherwise false.

      • removePar

        public static java.lang.String removePar(java.lang.String expr)
        Checks to see if the entire expression is surrounded by parentheses, in which case they will be removed for easier parsing

      • areAllLetters

        public static boolean areAllLetters(java.lang.String s)
        Evaluates a string to see if all chars are alphabetic (a-z or A-Z).
        Parameters:
        s - The string to evaluate
        Returns:
        If the s contains only alphabetic characters.

      • splitByNonNestedChars

        public static java.lang.String[] splitByNonNestedChars(java.lang.String s,
                                       char... c)
        Splits string s by any chars c for every occurrence of chars c that are not nested in parentheses. The characters at which s is split will be included at the beginning of the respective elements. Occurrences of chars c at the beginning of s will be ignored. Examples: splitByNonNestedChars("xy+6-4", '+', '-') returns ["xy", "+6", "-4"] splitByNonNestedChars("(4x)/(6y(2+x))", '/') returns ["(4x)", "/(6y(2+x))"]
        Parameters:
        s - The string to split.
        c - The chars by which to split s.
        Returns:
        A string array of s split by occurrences of chars c not nested in parentheses.

      • isSuperscript

        public static boolean isSuperscript(java.lang.String s)
        Tells if every char in s is a superscript.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to check.
        Returns:
        If every char in s is a valid superscript char.

      • superscriptToInt

        public static int superscriptToInt(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string of superscript chars to an int.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to parse.
        Returns:
        The int value of the superscript chars.

      • toSuperscript

        public static java.lang.String toSuperscript(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a given integer (in string form) to Unicode superscript.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to convert.
        Returns:
        The superscript form of s.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
